DOC.detailed_description: This study evaluate recently pilot , self-administered , computerized tool reduce prenatal drinking add novel component drink size assessment drink size feedback traditional screening brief intervention ( SBI ) . The bilingual ( English Spanish ) electronic SBI `` e-SBI '' adapt use non-pregnant woman small trial efficacy conduct two public health clinic . The effect drink size assessment depression modifier e-SBI efficacy also study . Study finding help design large trial e-SBI 's efficacy reduce prenatal alcohol use . An experimental design use propose small trial . Two hundred woman , pregnant past year report alcohol risky level randomly assign e-SBI usual care . Participants complete baseline , 3-month 6-month follow-up assessment . These assessment examine drink pregnancy well possible negative outcome , increase drug use associate e-SBI . To address methodological limitation prior research , study design incorporate drink size assessment well measure drink outcome , minimizes assessment reactivity control baseline , include booster e-SBI 3-month follow . This allow examination whether drink size assessment reduce drink effect equivalent full e-SBI . With design innovation , study expect provide information rigorously assess subsequent multi-arm trial . Because set stage Phase II trial e-SBI efficacy reduce prenatal alcohol use , propose study significance improve maternal child health . Findings also impact large intervention literature cost-effective strategy reduce alcohol-related harm .
